questions: Q. 1. Who introduced the term cell?
answers: Ans. Robert Hooke (in 1665) introduced the term cell.

questions: Q. 2. Define totipotency.
answers: Ans. Totipotency is the ability of living cells to form the whole organism unless and until they have become extremely specialized.

questions: Q. 3. Who proposed the cell theory?
answers: Ans. Matthias Schleiden (1838) and Theodore Schwann (1839).

questions: Q. 4. What are plasmodesmata?
answers: Ans. Protoplasmic or cytoplasmic bridges between adjacent plant cells in the areas of pits are called as plasmodesmata.

questions: Q. 5. Name two semi-autonomous bodies.
answers: Ans. (i) Chloroplast, (ii) Mitochondria.

questions: Q. 6. What are pili?
answers: Ans. Fili are elongated, tubular structure made up of special protein in bacteria.

questions: Q. 7. What is meant by cell differentiation?
answers: Ans. Cell differentiation is the phase of growth in which a cell acquires a permanent shape and function along with increase in size.

questions: Q. 8. Who gave the statement Omnis cellula-e cellula'?
answers: Ans. Rudolf Virchow.

questions: Q. 9. Give the significance of glyocalyx.
answers: Ans. It provides protection to the bacterial cells and also help in adhesion.

questions: Q. 10. What are fimbriae?
answers: Ans. Fimbriae are small, bristle like fibres sprouting out of the cell in bacteria.

questions: Q. 11. What is a cell sap?
answers: Ans. The liquid contents in the vacuoles of plant cells are termed as cell sap

questions: Q. 12. Define fertility factor.
answers: Ans. It is a factor present on a plasmid which converts the bacterium into a donor and capable of developing sex pili for conjugation.

questions: Q. 13. What is glycocalyx.
answers: Ans. Glycocalyx is the outermost mucilage layer of the cell envelope which consists of noncellulosic polysaccharides with or without proteins in prokaryotic cells.

questions: Q. 14. What is the nature of the cell wall ?
answers: Ans. The plant cell wall is a complex matrix of linked polysaccharides such as cellulose and pectin, forming a thick semi permeable rigid barrier outside the plasma membrane.

questions: Q. 15. Name the site of synthesis of glyolipids in a cell.
answers: Ans. Golgi apparatus.

questions: Q. 16. Name the organelle of the cell, called as' suicidal bags'
answers: Ans. Lysosome is called as 'suicidal bags' of the cell.

questions: Q. 17. What is plasmalemma ?
answers: Ans. Plasmalemma or plasma membrane or cell membrane is a biomembrane that occurs on the outside of the cytoplasm in both prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells

questions: Q. 18. Name the two subunits of ribosomes.
answers: Ans. The two subunits of ribosomes are larger and smaller subunits.

questions: Q. 19. Name the enzymes present in peroxisomes.
answers: Ans. Oxidases and catalases.

questions: Q. 20. Write the other name of nuclear envelop.
answers: Ans. Karyotheca.

questions: Q. 21. What are cytoskeletal structures?
answers: Ans. The cytoskeletal structure are microfilaments, intermediate filaments and microtubules.

questions: Q. 22. Who gave the term 'chromosome' ?
answers: Ans. Waldeyer (1881),

questions: Q. 23. What is diplosome ?
answers: Ans. A pair of centrioles are called diplosomes.

questions: Q. 24. Name four different forms of lysosomes.
answers: Ans. (i) Primary lysosome, (ii) Secondary lysosome, (iii) Autophagosomes, (iv) Residual bodies.

questions: Q. 25. Who proposed fluid mosaic model ?
answers: Ans. Singer and G. Nicolson.

questions: Q. 26. Define osmosis.
answers: Ans. Osmosis is a special type of diffusion in which only solvent molecules migrate across a semipermeable membrane from a region of low solute concentration to a region of high solute concentration.

questions: Q. 27. what is active transport ?
answers: Ans. Active transport is the movement of material across the membrane against their concentration or electrochemical gradient. It requires energy in the form of ATP for this process.

questions: Q. 28. What is the function of contractile vacuole ?
answers: Ans. Osmoregulation (water balance).

questions: Q. 29. What is desmotubule ?
answers: Ans. A fine cytoplasmic canal lined by plasma membrane and has ER.

questions: Q. 30. Name the ions which help in association of two ribosomal sub-units.
answers: Ans. Mg2+ ions.
